EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

We at Daily's Premium Meats are committed to employee, public, and environmental safety.

This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program

that covers areas such as the design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance and

employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system at our facility. It is our

policy to implement appropriate control measures to prevent possible releases of anhydrous

ammonia. If such a release were to occur, our highly trained employees are on hand to control

and mitigate the release. We are also completely coordinated with the South Salt Lake City Fire

Department, who provides our emergency response services. In addition, we have a contract

with L.A. Roser Company to provide 24 hour service and emergency response on the ammonia

refrigeration system.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:

We have one regulated extremely hazardous substance present at our facility. This substance is

Ammonia (anhydrous). The maximum inventory of Ammonia (anhydrous) that is expected to be

present in this facility, based on process/operational requirements, is 16,108 pounds.



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific

Prevention Steps:

We have taken the following steps as required by 40CFR, Part 68 of the EPA Clean Air Act

regulation. Our ammonia process is subject to the OSHA PSM regulation, 29CFR1910.119. Our

ammonia process is also subject to the EPCRA Section 302 reporting requirements. The

following sections briefly describe the elements of the accidental release prevention program

that we have in place.

Process Safety Information: Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards

associated with our ammonia refrigeration process are identified and controlled efficiently and

safely. The methodology used to cond

uct these analyses is the What-If Checklist. These studies

are conducted by the qualified engineers and technicians of the L.A. Roser Company and are

re-validated at a regular interval of every three years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis

are corrected as soon as possible.

Operating Procedures: Daily's Premium Meats maintains written operating procedures. These

procedures address various modes of operation including initial start-up, normal operations,

emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown, and a start-up after a

turnaround. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to all operators and

contractors involved in the process.

Training: Our facility has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees

and contractors who are operating the ammonia system are qualified to follow the required

procedures. Our Maintenance Manager is RETA certified through Garden City Community

College, and several other technicians have also received ammonia system training at that

facility. We evaluate each operator independently to evaluate their readiness to operate our

plant. All employees also receive interactive training through the Alchemy Training System at

least annually.

Mechanical Integrity: We conduct well documented maintenance and inspections for the

ammonia refrigeration system to ensure that it is operating properly. Process equipment

examined during the maintenance and inspections includes pressure vessels, storage tanks,

piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.

Only qualified personnel with specialized ammonia system training conduct maintenance

operations. Any deficiencies identified during maintenance or inspection are corrected as soon

as possible.

Management of Change: Written procedures are in place to manage changes to the ammonia

refrigeration system process, chemicals, technology and equipment. Process operations,

maintenan

ce and contractor personnel, or any other employees whose job tasks are affected by

a modification of process operations, are promptly informed of and given training to safely

manage the modification and operate the system.

Pre-Startup Reviews: Pre-startup reviews related to new processes, and/or modifications to

existing processes are conducted as a regular practice at our facility. These reviews are

conducted to confirm that the design, installation, maintenance and operation of the ammonia

refrigeration plant is safe prior to any equipment operation.

Compliance Audits: We conduct audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions

required by the Process Safety and Risk Management regulations are being consistently

implemented. These audits are conducted at least every three years and any corrective actions

noted during the audits are corrected as soon as possible.

Incident Investigation: Daily's Premium Meats has not had to conduct an incident investigation.

We are prepared to investigate any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably have

resulted in, a catastrophic release of ammonia. These investigations would be conducted to

identify the situation leading to the incident, as well as any corrective actions to prevent the

incident from recurring. All reports from the investigation would be kept for a minimum of five

years.

Employee Participation: Our Company believes that Process Safety, Risk Management and

accident prevention require a team effort to be successful. Company and contractor employees

are strongly urged to express their concerns about the ammonia refrigeration system and

recommend any improvements to the system. They are also encouraged to report any possible

safety issues with the ammonia plant. In addition, all employees and contractors have access to

all information related to the facility Process Safety and Risk Management plans.

Contractors: Occasionally we hire contractors to conduct specialized test

ing, maintenance and

construction activities for the ammonia refrigeration system. Our current contractor for these

activities is the L.A. Roser Company in Salt Lake City, Utah. Prior to selecting any contractor,

we conduct a thorough evaluation of their safety performance. We have a strict policy of

informing all contractors of any potential hazards with our ammonia system and throughout the

plant. Contractors are also informed of all procedures for emergency notification, evacuation

and employee accountability in the event of an ammonia release.



4. Five Year Accident History:

There have been no reportable accidents or incidents at this facility during the past five years.



5. Emergency Action Plan:

Daily's Premium Meats is included in the Salt Lake City emergency response plan. This facility

also has a written emergency action plan. The emergency plan includes specific actions to be

taken in response to an accidental release of ammonia. The emergency action plan also

includes procedures for informing the public and local, state and federal response agencies of

an ammonia release. This plan also identifies the facility First Responders. These are

designated employees who have been certified in First Aid, CPR and emergency evacuation.

The date of the most recent review/update of the emergency action plan was 8/31/09.

The date of the most recent emergency action training for all employees was 10/31/09.

The local agency that is coordinating our emergency response plan is the South Salt Lake City

Fire Department. Their non-emergency number is 801-483-6043.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Our RETA trained Maintenance Manager, working together with L.A. Roser Company, maintains

our Anhydrous Ammonia plant in excellent condition. We will continue to work with the South

Salt Lake City Fire Department to conduct mock incident drills at our facility. All employees will

be trained on ammonia safety and emergency evacuation at least annually.

We will continue to

ensure that only qualified; specifically trained personnel will operate and maintain our ammonia

plant. At Daily's Premium Meats, we take our obligation to handle our anhydrous ammonia

safely very seriously. In doing so, we protect our employees, vendors, contractors, and the local

community from exposure to anhydrous ammonia.
